data.prayer: Father, make bold the prophets in Jayuya, Puerto Rico so that the church can be equipped with truth and insight and a vision of your heart.
data.verse: These are the things which you should do: speak the truth to one another; judge with truth and judgment for peace in your gates.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Jayuya, Puerto Rico
data.section_summary: What needs would people have here?

data.prayer: God, we pray for the believers in Jayuya, Puerto Rico that they will know how to spend an hour in prayer with you.

data.section_summary: On average, 4 babies will be born in the next month to families who might know about God culturally, but likely have no relationship with Jesus in Jayuya, Puerto Rico.
data.prayer: Spirit, reveal yourself to these new families.
There are 13,900 people living in the state of Jayuya. Only about 4,519 might be believers.
Father, help your children in Jayuya, Puerto Rico find someone like the Samaritan Woman today. Someone who will open an entire town to your message of salvation.
data.verse: So the woman left her water jar and went away into town and said to the people, 29 “Come, see a man who told me all that I ever did. Can this be the Christ?” They went out of the town and were coming to him.

data.prayer: Lord, the the state of Jayuya will disappear one day, but your Word will never disappear. Call all who claim Christianity to anchor their lives on your Word.
data.verse: Heaven and earth will disappear, but my words will never disappear.

data.prayer: Lord, let it be said of the 9,381 lost in Jayuya that you have called them out of darkness into your glorious light.
data.verse: But you are a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for God’s own possession, that you may proclaim the excellence of him who called you out of darkness into his marvelous light

data.prayer: Jesus, defend your people in the state of Jayuya against the difficulty of these last days.
data.verse: But mark this: There will be terrible times in the last days. 2 People will be lovers of themselves, lovers of money, boastful, proud, abusive, disobedient to their parents, ungrateful, unholy, 3 without love, unforgiving, slanderous, without self-control, brutal, not lovers of the good, 4 treacherous, rash, conceited, lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God— 5 having a form of godliness but denying its power.
